intro: Galeola cassythoides, commonly known as the slender yellowweed, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Scrophulariaceae family, which includes many flowering plants with showy, often colorful blooms. The plant typically grows in moist, sandy soils and is often found in open woodlands or along streambanks. Its small, yellow flowers are arranged in clusters and bloom in the summer months. The leaves are opposite, oval-shaped, and have a slightly rough texture.
